courtesy of /u/dsigal
Force Friday will see the release of 8 cards. One exclusive card for each tier that you achieve. These cards are previews of the first 8 Rogue One sets that they are releasing. Each card is a variant of the first card of each Rogue One set. So 8 different cards, each one previewing a different set. The preview cards are not guaranteed for achieving the Tier, you still need to chase in packs These previews will not be a part of the set needed for the award, but obtaining them will get you better odds in chasing the set. You have til Thursday to complete the Tier chase to whatever level you get to There may have been some other info, go check it out.

WRITING.TITLE: Early draft of the dark tower script

WRITING.TEXT: Its a lot different from the book. Especially in that save for the stuff in Tull almost none of the story comes from the book. It kinda combines stuff from all of the books. I hated it as an adaptation of the Gunslinger but enjoyed it as a Dark Tower story
I just finished it thats why I'm lurking on this thread right now. I liked the ending with jakes death I thought it was an interesting spin on the ending to the book
they sort of combine the Manni stuff from Wolves of the calla with the aunt Talitha scene in The Wastelands
me too its sooooo different but its the same too. The ending with jake I think is actually better (almost) than in the novel
thats if they release any other version in vinyl

the similarities are very broad. Mr. holland's opus is more about the life and career one of one man spanning decades. Whiplash is about a gifted students relationship with his overbearing teacher. They are both good in their own right.
